name: 04-BusinessValidation-Prophet
parameters: --var getStarted=true --var EDAStore='Curtain Wall' --var EDAItem='Curtain Wall 36','Curtain Wall 50','Curtain Wall 60','Curtain Wall 61.5','Vortex 70' --var execute=true --var trainStore='Curtain Wall','Hinged','Sliding','Standard Profiles' --var trainItem='Curtain Wall 36','Curtain Wall 50','Curtain Wall 60','Curtain Wall 61.5','Vortex 70','Non-Thermal','Thermal Break','Angles','Tubes','Bars' --var modelSelection=1 --var trainModel1=true --var modelSelection=0 --var trainModel=true --var destinationPath=/home/sparkflows/fire-data/projects-customers/MANUFACTURING/Demand-Forecasting-Manufacturing/Processed-Datasets/ --var runModelValidaion=true

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

nodes.name: Join Using SQL
nodes.description: This node registers the incoming DataFrames as temporary tables and executes the SQL provided

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTables
fields.title: Temp Table Names
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT 
cast(a.Sales_Date as Date) as Sales_Date,
a.Total_Quantity_Sold as Actual_Sales,
b.yhat as Forecasted_Sales,
b.yhat_upper,
b.yhat_lower 
FROM tempTable1 a JOIN tempTable2 b on a.Sales_Date=b.ds
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT AVG(ABS(Actual_Sales - Forecasted_Sales) / NULLIF(Actual_Sales, 0)) * 100 AS MAPE,
SQRT(AVG((Actual_Sales - Forecasted_Sales) * (Actual_Sales - Forecasted_Sales))) AS RMSE
FROM fire_temp_table
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.name: text
fields.value:
Conclusion

The Prophet forecasting model appears to be performing well on the validation data, accurately capturing the sales trends and providing reasonable confidence intervals for future sales predictions.
